titleStmt.title: The argument of Master Nicholas Fuller, in the case of Thomas Lad, and Richard Maunsell, his clients Wherein it is plainely proved, that the Ecclesiasticall Commissioners haue no power, by vertue of their commission, to imprison, to put to the Oath ex officio, or to fine any of his Maiesties subiects.
titleStmt.author: Fuller, Nicholas, 1543-1620.

titleStmt.title: The argument of Master Nicholas Fuller, in the case of Thomas Lad, and Richard Maunsell, his clients Wherein it is plainely proved, that the Ecclesiasticall Commissioners haue no power, by vertue of their commission, to imprison, to put to the Oath ex officio, or to fine any of his Maiesties subiects.
titleStmt.author: Fuller, Nicholas, 1543-1620.

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The argument of Nicholas Fuller.
With one erratum on pi2v. Variant: with three errata.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
